deleted_lines: # lib/savanna # Dependencies: # ``functions`` file # ``DEST``, ``DATA_DIR``, ``STACK_USER`` must be defined # ``stack.sh`` calls the entry points in this order: # # install_savanna # configure_savanna # start_savanna # stop_savanna # cleanup_savanna # Save trace setting XTRACE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # Defaults # -------- # Set up default repos SAVANNA_REPO=${SAVANNA_REPO:-${GIT_BASE}/openstack/savanna.git} SAVANNA_BRANCH=${SAVANNA_BRANCH:-master} # Set up default directories SAVANNA_DIR=$DEST/savanna SAVANNA_CONF_DIR=${SAVANNA_CONF_DIR:-/etc/savanna} SAVANNA_CONF_FILE=${SAVANNA_CONF_DIR}/savanna.conf SAVANNA_DEBUG=${SAVANNA_DEBUG:-True} SAVANNA_SERVICE_HOST=${SAVANNA_SERVICE_HOST:-$SERVICE_HOST} SAVANNA_SERVICE_PORT=${SAVANNA_SERVICE_PORT:-8386} SAVANNA_SERVICE_PROTOCOL=${SAVANNA_SERVICE_PROTOCOL:-$SERVICE_PROTOCOL} SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR=${SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR:-/var/cache/savanna} # Support entry points installation of console scripts if [[ -d $SAVANNA_DIR/bin ]]; then SAVANNA_BIN_DIR=$SAVANNA_DIR/bin else SAVANNA_BIN_DIR=$(get_python_exec_prefix) fi # Tell Tempest this project is present TEMPEST_SERVICES+=,savanna # Functions # --------- # create_savanna_accounts() - Set up common required savanna accounts # # Tenant User Roles # ------------------------------ # service savanna admin function create_savanna_accounts { SERVICE_TENANT=$(openstack project list | awk "/ $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME / { print \$2 }") ADMIN_ROLE=$(openstack role list | awk "/ admin / { print \$2 }") SAVANNA_USER=$(openstack user create \ savanna \ --password "$SERVICE_PASSWORD" \ --project $SERVICE_TENANT \ --email savanna@example.com \ | grep " id " | get_field 2) openstack role add \ $ADMIN_ROLE \ --project $SERVICE_TENANT \ --user $SAVANNA_USER if [[ "$KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND" = 'sql' ]]; then SAVANNA_SERVICE=$(openstack service create \ savanna \ --type=data_processing \ --description="Savanna Data Processing" \ | grep " id " | get_field 2) openstack endpoint create \ $SAVANNA_SERVICE \ --region RegionOne \ --publicurl "$SAVANNA_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$SAVANNA_SERVICE_HOST:$SAVANNA_SERVICE_PORT/v1.1/\$(tenant_id)s" \ --adminurl "$SAVANNA_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$SAVANNA_SERVICE_HOST:$SAVANNA_SERVICE_PORT/v1.1/\$(tenant_id)s" \ --internalurl "$SAVANNA_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$SAVANNA_SERVICE_HOST:$SAVANNA_SERVICE_PORT/v1.1/\$(tenant_id)s" fi } # cleanup_savanna() - Remove residual data files, anything left over from # previous runs that would need to clean up. function cleanup_savanna { # Cleanup auth cache dir sudo rm -rf $SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR } # configure_savanna() - Set config files, create data dirs, etc function configure_savanna { if [[ ! -d $SAVANNA_CONF_DIR ]]; then sudo mkdir -p $SAVANNA_CONF_DIR fi sudo chown $STACK_USER $SAVANNA_CONF_DIR # Copy over savanna configuration file and configure common parameters. cp $SAVANNA_DIR/etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE # Create auth cache dir sudo mkdir -p $SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR sudo chown $STACK_USER $SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR rm -rf $SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR/* # Set obsolete keystone auth configs for backward compatibility iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT os_auth_host $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT os_auth_port $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT os_auth_protocol $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT os_admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT os_admin_username savanna iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT os_admin_tenant_name $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME # Set actual keystone auth configs iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken auth_uri $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST:$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT/ iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken admin_tenant_name $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken admin_user savanna iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken signing_dir $SAVANNA_AUTH_CACHE_DIR iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken cafile $KEYSTONE_SSL_CA iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT debug $SAVANNA_DEBUG iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE database connection `database_connection_url savanna` if is_service_enabled neutron; then iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT use_neutron true iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT use_floating_ips true fi if is_service_enabled heat; then iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT infrastructure_engine heat else iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT infrastructure_engine savanna fi iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT use_syslog $SYSLOG recreate_database savanna utf8 $SAVANNA_BIN_DIR/savanna-db-manage --config-file $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE upgrade head } # install_savanna() - Collect source and prepare function install_savanna { git_clone $SAVANNA_REPO $SAVANNA_DIR $SAVANNA_BRANCH setup_develop $SAVANNA_DIR } # start_savanna() - Start running processes, including screen function start_savanna { screen_it savanna "cd $SAVANNA_DIR && $SAVANNA_BIN_DIR/savanna-api --config-file $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE" } # stop_savanna() - Stop running processes function stop_savanna { # Kill the Savanna screen windows screen -S $SCREEN_NAME -p savanna -X kill } # Restore xtrace $XTRACE # Local variables: # mode: shell-script # End:

commit_message:
SeaMicro use device parameter for set_boot_device

To have consistency between the different drivers, we modify
SeaMicro to make use of the 'device' parameter instead of
'boot_device', as the other drivers are using, for the set_boot_device
vendorpassthru.

Change-Id: Id7e07924c4c028013db29566952d8dbd317a9f2c

commit_message:
Stop editing config.json.

Now that the t-i-e element supports reading local.json in preference
to config.json, we can put our edited state in local.json and avoid
dirtying the git tree.

Change-Id: Iecbc4f379710242f4355e2f8c4050fc2edc7dd06

Put overcloud state into testenv.json.

Sourcing devtest_overcloud is ugly, so like we did for undercloud,
turn it into a script we call that exports data itself.

commit_message:
docs: Relative links improvements

- replace two separate blocks for previous and next chapter on side
  bar with common 'Navigation' block;
- add link to table of contents to the block, as it's not that easy
  to find one in current layout.

commit_message:
docs: Ingore 'taskflow.' prefix when sorting module index

This makes e.g. 'taskflow.atom' appear under 'a', not under 't'.

Related blueprint sphinx-docs

Change-Id: I4810f25d8145ead96b022faddf9c9d69b7fa0760

commit_message:
API v2: Allow GET on unowned images with show_image_direct_url

This fixes an issue where copy.deepcopy was being a called
on an ImmutableLocations object, causing a Forbidden to be
raised.

Change-Id: Ia7ac121478cf63d68bd5a3d91faa51a42afeb2fe
Closes-Bug: 1287888

commit_message:
Fix username's maximum length to match the backend

when create a user, we can input length more 255 character,
but it will report a error 'User name should not be greater
than 255 characters (HTTP 400)'.

Change-Id: Ib2a3d2f6783e1c107d9a2cf87877442a9171480d
Closes-bug:#1291216

commit_message:
Make the Nova Ironic driver to wait for ACTIVE

After returning from spawn() Nova will set the status of the instance
to ACTIVE, but that's wrong because Ironic does the deploy in an async
fashion. So this patch makes the Nova spawn() method to wait for the
Node being provision by Ironic to be on the ACTIVE (or DEPLOYFAIL)
state before returning.

Change-Id: I057a6e2e9fc6f4c85b7b2b9c63f541248b1214ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/06/79906/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # wait for the node to be marked as ACTIVE in Ironic def _wait_for_active(node_uuid): node = icli.node.get(node_uuid) if node.provision_state == ironic_states.ACTIVE: raise loopingcall.LoopingCallDone() if node.provision_state == ironic_states.DEPLOYFAIL: msg = _("Failed to provision node %(node)s") % node_uuid LOG.error(msg) raise exception.NovaException(msg) timer = loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall(_wait_for_active, node_uuid) # TODO(lucasagomes): Make the time configurable timer.start(interval=10).wait()

commit_message:
Move load_user_creds out of StackWatch

This method was moved out of EngineService in a recent refactor
however load_user_creds not related to stack watching, so this
method is better off living in EngineService.

Change-Id: I67fa06df5c24baa901dc6314205ea09d012437fb

commit_message:
Devstack getting started, update IMAGE_URLS

The current image references are F17 which are very EOL and
unsupported, so instead refer to the official F20 image which
now contains heat-cfntools, and mention that in the documentation.

Change-Id: I4906fe4f0785c23b3f8815dbaa0a4727f8ed9505
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/07/80007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IMAGE_URLS+=",http://cloud.fedoraproject.org/fedora-20.x86_64.qcow2" URLs for any cloud image may be specified, but fedora images from F20 contain the heat-cfntools package which is required for some heat functionality.
deleted_lines: IMAGE_URLS+=",http://fedorapeople.org/groups/heat/prebuilt-jeos-images/F17-x86_64-cfntools.qcow2,http://fedorapeople.org/groups/heat/prebuilt-jeos-images/F17-i386-cfntools.qcow2" URLs for any of [http://fedorapeople.org/groups/heat/prebuilt-jeos-images/ these prebuilt JEOS images] can be specified.

commit_message:
Split up stop_nova to match start_nova

Split stop_nova into: stop_nova_compute and stop_nova_rest. This is
needed to support the partial-ncpu grenade test where we want to stop
everything but nova_compute.

Change-Id: I6a21821277e56897d705ca5746806e2211632d12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/80017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function stop_nova_compute { if is_service_enabled n-cpu && [[ -r $NOVA_PLUGINS/hypervisor-$VIRT_DRIVER ]]; then stop_nova_hypervisor fi } function stop_nova_rest {} # stop_nova() - Stop running processes (non-screen) function stop_nova { stop_nova_rest stop_nova_compute
deleted_lines: # stop_nova() - Stop running processes (non-screen) function stop_nova { if is_service_enabled n-cpu && [[ -r $NOVA_PLUGINS/hypervisor-$VIRT_DRIVER ]]; then stop_nova_hypervisor fi

added_lines: Message queuing service for `OpenStack`_. To find more information read our `wiki`_.3. Find ``[drivers]`` section in ``~/.marconi/marconi.conf`` and specify to use mongodb storage:: storage = mongodb Then find the ``[drivers:storage:mongodb]`` section and modify the URI to point to your local mongod instance:: "Content-type: application/json"Running tests ------------- First install additional requirements:: pip install -r test-requirements.txt pip install tox And then run tests:: tox -e py27 You can read more about running functional tests in separate `README`_... _`wiki` : https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Marconi/ .. _README : https://github.com/openstack/marconi/blob/master/tests/functional/README.rst

subject: WIP Add Object Version Registry WIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-27 18:21:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/registry.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_registry.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/229_add_object_version_tracking.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/12a297703d8183c6de21638d7b4d93ebfa8185ed', 'message': "WIP Add Object Version Registry WIP

This adds an object version registry, which we will be able to use
to track which version of an object each host/service has during
an upgrade phase. This is needed so that, for example, the nova-api
service can properly backlevel objects before it sends them to
older compute nodes.

A new table (object_versions) is added, which stores object names
and versions for each host/service. Instead of storing every version
of every object for every service, it only stores those that are
older than the conductor node's objects. So, if everything is running
the same level of code, (basically) nothing will be stored in this
table. When a conductor is upgraded, it will be able to start
storing object version deltas.

The expectation is that compute nodes will report their object
versions very rarely, perhaps only once per invocation.

NOTE: This new object isn't a direct mapping to the sqlalchemy
model. Also, since we've been talking about doing away with db/api,
I thought I would try creating this one with native code inside,
instead of synthesizing new db/api methods for it, just to see/show
what it will be like. I can add db/api methods if desirable.

TODO:
 - Conductor needs to store its versions in the database
 - Conductor needs to realize that if its records are older
   than its own versions that computes without records are old
 - Probably need one persistent record per compute as a marker

Change-Id: Iaa613a1691d592129af2602dff90155bc2ed22a5
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Add Object Version Registry WIP

This adds an object version registry, which we will be able to use
to track which version of an object each host/service has during
an upgrade phase. This is needed so that, for example, the nova-api
service can properly backlevel objects before it sends them to
older compute nodes.

A new table (object_versions) is added, which stores object names
and versions for each host/service. Instead of storing every version
of every object for every service, it only stores those that are
older than the conductor node's objects. So, if everything is running
the same level of code, (basically) nothing will be stored in this
table. When a conductor is upgraded, it will be able to start
storing object version deltas.

The expectation is that compute nodes will report their object
versions very rarely, perhaps only once per invocation.

NOTE: This new object isn't a direct mapping to the sqlalchemy
model. Also, since we've been talking about doing away with db/api,
I thought I would try creating this one with native code inside,
instead of synthesizing new db/api methods for it, just to see/show
what it will be like. I can add db/api methods if desirable.

TODO:
 - Conductor needs to store its versions in the database
 - Conductor needs to realize that if its records are older
   than its own versions that computes without records are old
 - Probably need one persistent record per compute as a marker

Change-Id: Iaa613a1691d592129af2602dff90155bc2ed22a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/58837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enforce groups presence for federated authn

Check whether all the groups issued by the RuleProcessor are present in
the backend. The request is rejected with an authentication error if no
groups are issued. If any of the issued groups are not found in the
backend, an unexpected error (500) is returned with a message explaining
which group was not found. Also, this policy is applied when an unscoped
token is being scoped.

Change-Id: I8b843fc567892289fba4c04b7e8b1dfd63d1e9ca
Closes-bug: #1290258

commit_message:
vmware: Mark VMware ESX vmdk driver as deprecated

The VMware ESX driver in Nova is now marked as deprecated and will be
removed in Juno release. This change marks the VMware ESX vmdk driver
as deprecated since it is intended for use with the ESX driver in Nova.
The plan is to remove the ESX vmdk driver in Juno release.

Closes-Bug: #1291194
DocImpact
Change-Id: I285f3461c1ccef56329b70417fb023405dfceb5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/93/79893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
enable plugins to override templates

Currently, templates provided by plugins will searched with
last priority, thus overriding via plugins is currently not
possible.

Change-Id: I05981b75e147d5e1ae952144d4acc8c909513444
Closes-Bug: #1289305

subject: Fix 'spacing' parameters for periodic tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-13 14:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/c9cc8800da6ff458e01c6a7001ebc0b45a0f5846', 'message': "Fix 'spacing' parameters for periodic tasks

conductor.manager module contains 'spacing' parameters for periodic
tasks, they do not work because manager module imported before
parsing config options. Oslo code uses metaclass for collect
periodical tasks with options, therefore add periodical tasks
options lazyly not possible via periodic_task decorator. This
patch uses _periodic_spacing attribute of base class.

Partial-Bug: #1279774
Change-Id: Ia6f60ddc00cc3f6f57925ddade5a46dcebaca852
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'spacing' parameters for periodic tasks

conductor.manager module contains 'spacing' parameters for periodic
tasks, they do not work because manager module imported before
parsing config options. Oslo code uses metaclass for collect
periodical tasks with options, therefore add periodical tasks
options lazyly not possible via periodic_task decorator. This
patch uses _periodic_spacing attribute of base class.

Partial-Bug: #1279774

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary sorting from search

The existing sort was only applied to some result sets.  Instead
of sorting all sets, I don't think any sorting is needed at this
level of code.  Consumers of these methods can choose to sort if
really needed.

Closes bug: 1289441

Change-Id: I0bba67b0ae23f513c27fb67265686704a1000769

commit_message:
Use InnoDB for mysql on redhat

The default for mysql 5.5 is InnoDB. Ubuntu and SuSE use 5.5, but
Rehdat uses 5.1 with default of myISAM. Openstack core projets
require InnoDB. Some of core projects do not handle setting the
engine properly when creating tables.
Bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1288358,
The mysql cookbook also does not allow this to be overridden
(https://tickets.opscode.com/browse/COOK-4370).
This patch is a workaround until those bugs are fixed.

Change-Id: I0bd2ed5ffb97a979551a68df5d6bbc2f533fcd57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-database refs/changes/76/78276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe 'openstack.cnf' do before do @file = @chef_run.find_resource(:file, '/etc/mysql/conf.d/openstack.cnf') end it 'is created if needed' do expect(@chef_run).to create_file_if_missing(@file.name) end it 'has proper owner' do expect(@file.owner).to eq('root') expect(@file.group).to eq('root') end it 'has proper modes' do expect(sprintf('%o', @file.mode)).to eq '644' end it 'has proper content' do match = 'default-storage-engine = InnoDB' expect(@chef_run).to render_file(@file.name).with_content(match) end it 'notifies mysql to restart' do expect(@file).to notify('service[mysql-start]').to(:restart) end end

commit_message:
98-source-repositories tries to return from script

In 8b2325118ff8d3334d51d86d293962acc8dd0962 we added a line
so that 98-source-repositories tries to return from the top
level script (not from within a function).

Also, remove the return 1 within the function as well
because we just want to continue in these cases.

Change-Id: I66eddc12208b278594a0a8d8676c38d72045ca75

commit_message:
Making 'body' param optional for resp validation

This patch makes the base.py->validate_response method
'body' parameter as optional parameter to validate
the response with no response body.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I65848738037b1a34d8572ea15dcc862ecdc345f3

commit_message:
Use range instead xrange to keep python 3.X compatibility

xrange is replaced by range in python3. Lists that be created
in the test cases are short, so just use range instead.

closes-bug: #1291191

Change-Id: I8e604ea62150905563cb90aa0d227b11628e9ecc

commit_message:
Check BMC availability in ipmitool 'validate' method

Check that BMC is accessible with provided IPMI credentials added
to 'validate' method of ipmitool driver, simple command 'mc guid'
used.

commit_message:
Add admin_metadata 'protected' for volume

Aim to enhance the protect for the volume to avoid delete by mistake.
The volume can't be deleted until the 'protected' is setted to 'False'.
An exception is the volume is deleted by force.

Partly-Implements: blueprint protected-volume
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/protected-volume

Change-Id: I33489abe7b9846103e8b158266ec868e6a969530
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/16/80316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: volume_metadata = self.get_volume_admin_metadata(context, volume) if 'protected' in volume_metadata: if not force and volume_metadata['protected'] == 'True': # Volume is still protected, so it can't be deleted raise exception.VolumeProtected(volume_id=volume_id) def update_protected_flag(self, context, volume, flag): if volume['status'] != 'available': msg = _('Volume status must be available to update protected flag.') raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) self.update_volume_admin_metadata(context.elevated(), volume, {'protected': str(flag)}) @wrap_check_policy

subject: Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 13:00:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/984b9bbc43f6c7b2445f33c36ef623574e98a8c9', 'message': "Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores

1f6381a73f5c99f1f731d6c4f9defb91bd2d042d disabled all stores by default,
this casues upgrade issues for CD environments and folks that are not
aware of the change. This patch adds a way to attempt enabling the store
if its configuration parameters were set. If the store fails to load and
it's not in `known_stores` then no error will be reported.

The patch also wans the user when a store succeeds to load but it was
not explicitly enabled in `known_stores`. Note that there may be false
positives since some stores may not require any configuration parameter.

Change-Id: Ie784fe90003a5064aaf16fadb7266bf7a46e2cf5
Closes-Bug: #1290969
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-12 13:04:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/79ad7b6d9769ae06953ede1d1fce06fc96184b8d', 'message': "Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores

1f6381a73f5c99f1f731d6c4f9defb91bd2d042d disabled all stores by default,
this casues upgrade issues for CD environments and folks that are not
aware of the change. This patch adds a way to attempt enabling the store
if its configuration parameters were set. If the store fails to load and
it's not in `known_stores` then no error will be reported.

The patch also wans the user when a store succeeds to load but it was
not explicitly enabled in `known_stores`. Note that there may be false
positives since some stores may not require any configuration parameter.

Change-Id: Ie784fe90003a5064aaf16fadb7266bf7a46e2cf5

commit_message:
Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores

1f6381a73f5c99f1f731d6c4f9defb91bd2d042d disabled all stores by default,
this casues upgrade issues for CD environments and folks that are not
aware of the change. This patch adds a way to attempt enabling the store
if its configuration parameters were set. If the store fails to load and
it's not in `known_stores` then no error will be reported.

The patch also warns the user when a store succeeds to load but it was
not explicitly enabled in `known_stores`. Note that there may be false
positives since some stores may not require any configuration parameter.

Change-Id: Ie784fe90003a5064aaf16fadb7266bf7a46e2cf5
Closes-Bug: #1290969

commit_message:
Revert "Adds L3 agent test case to test_l3_agent_scheduler.py"

This patch introduced bug 1291694, which has had 76 failures in check
and  gate queues in the last two days (since it got merged). So revert
this and then sort out why its not working.

This reverts commit 6869613978939d78afa3d366d00bff33ce9a9a20.
Related-Bug: #1291694

Change-Id: I8bd22667400b9205f7d0e77e8fd478ecbc6d6c23

commit_message:
Cleanup keystoneclient tests

I remove redundant calls to load backends and initialize the database to
hopefully make these tests a little faster. I also added some cleanup
for instance attributes to help with memory consumption.

Change-Id: If2afec11266e0cd4cd132800259c4d4f84644600

commit_message:
Re-raise exception of unloadable library

The patch re-raises the exception when a stevedore extention fails to
load.

Before this patch, the config generator silently ignore options
from a library (-l) when the oslo.config.opts entry point of the
library fail to load, and result to an incomplete configuration file.

Closes bug #1287789

Change-Id: I58ce4f0b0c422c558f2465fb008ce72b7dffc50f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/34/77934/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def raise_extension_exception(extmanager, ep, err): raise RuntimeError("Error importing module %s: %s\n" % (ep.module_name, str(err))) on_load_failure_callback=raise_extension_exception

commit_message:
Adds explanation of the Keystone Assignments feature

Adds explanation of Assignments feature, with configuration details
for enabling a SQL backend in Keystone.

Change-Id: Ic9ac68eada1730877ad8203df75d56920a6d35cc
Partial-Bug: #1202902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/40/79240/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <simplesect> <title>Assignment</title> <para> The Assignment feature enables a combination of LDAP and SQL for Identity Service authentication and authorization. Assignment allows you to manage project and role authorization within Identity Service's own SQL database, while still providing user authentication using an LDAP directory. The Assignment driver is enabled in the <filename>keystone.conf</filename> file alongside the LDAP driver: <programlisting> [identity] driver = keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity [assignment] driver = keystone.assignment.backends.sql.Assignment </programlisting> </para> </simplesect>

commit_message:
Cleanup backends after each test

Instance variables lingering around after a test completes can waste a
significant amount of memory during a long test run. This commit adds a
general helper method that can be used by add test classes to clean up
instance variables.

Change-Id: Ie7554f4c2e6e80540ea9f393f29b0eb15cacdf8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/26/79726/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def cleanup_instance(self, *names): """Create a function suitable for use with self.addCleanup. :returns: a callable that uses a closure to delete instance attributes """ def cleanup(): for name in names: # TODO(dstanek): remove this 'if' statement once # load_backend in test_backend_ldap is only called once # per test if hasattr(self, name): delattr(self, name) return cleanup self.addCleanup(self.cleanup_instance(*drivers.keys())) self.addCleanup(self.cleanup_instance('engine'))

commit_message:
Fix InvalidInstanceID.NotFound handling

The matcher used with boto tests is returing with None,
 when it matches. The incorrect condition handling may lead to
longer deletion time or failure.

Change-Id: I7d03528ab6183dd9a49169c0a6ec2a4a95fb7d52

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/35/73035/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Override the default sources.list For APT based systems, if your network connection is slow for the default sources.list in the upstream cloud image, you can define DIB\_APT\_SOURCES with your favorite sources.list to override it, before running devtest.sh.If you want to use this element with tripleo-incubator scripts, set NODE\_DIST / SEED\_DIB\_EXTRA\_ARGS / UNDERCLOUD\_DIB\_EXTRA\_ARGS / OVERCLOUD\_DIB\_EXTRA\_ARGS to make it take effect at the appropriate time. For instance, before running devtest.sh: export DIB\_APT\_SOURCES=/etc/apt/sources.list export SEED\_DIST="ubuntu apt-sources"
deleted_lines: Override the default sources.list For Ubuntu OS, if your network connection is slow for the default sources.list, you can define DIB_APT_SOURCES with your favorite sources.list to override it, before running devtest.sh.If you want to use this element in tripleo project, set NODE_DIST or EXTRA_ELEMENTS / UNDERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS / OVERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS to make it take effect at build time and run time. e.g. before running devtest.sh: export DIB_APT_SOURCES=/etc/apt/sources.list export NODE_DIST="ubuntu apt-sources"

commit_message:
Create a git manifest from source-repositories

As git repositories are copied into the image make a note of their
details and add them to a manifest on the build system.

This allows the code used in building an image to be found after
the image build is completed without needing to open the image up
for inspection.

Change-Id: I7dbe9e163ad38a418cf2869a81e720de2c27dfb1

commit_message:
Enable the basic dev doc for Marconi

Adding sphinx_build config in setup.cfg, the conf.py which
needed by sphinx_build. And a default index.rst.

Partially implement blueprint: docs

Change-Id: Icfd25f212681595055e5326831191391fd41ed19

commit_message:
Correct RBAC response codes

Change response code form 401 to 403 when an authenticated user attempts to access a resource they do not have permission to.

Closes-Bug: 1291008
Change-Id: I3954da658eaa73e96d0ba1eb91c0892bb03f5fea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/49/79749/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _not_allowed(message, req, resp): """Throw exception for forbidden resource.""" api.abort(falcon.HTTP_403, message, req, resp) _not_allowed(u._("URI tenant does not match " "authenticated tenant."), req, resp)
deleted_lines: def _authorization_failed(message, req, resp): """Throw exception that authorization failed.""" api.abort(falcon.HTTP_401, message, req, resp) _authorization_failed(u._("URI tenant does not match " "authenticated tenant."), req, resp)
